page.title: 19Truro - Cornwall's Centre 1
page.content: Truro is the only City in Cornwall. It is not the County town, Bodmin is, though the County Courts are moving to Truro soon. It is not the largest urban area, St Austell is,but recently Truro has become the fastest growing and most prosperous town in Cornwall. Truro is a centre of Cornish life in many ways. It has good communications, several main roads converge here, it has a main line station and a bus depot. County Hall, the Headquarters of the County Council, is on the outskirts of the City, providing employment and activity. Cornwall's two main hospitals are here, Treliske just outside our area, and the City Hospital, providing Casualty and Ambulance service for most of the County. The Cathedral and Bishop of Truro are the focus of Church of England activities in the County.
